Integrated Filter Methods

Table of Contents

  • Current methods
  • Deprecated methods
Source: vignettes/tutorial/filter_methods.Rmd

The following table shows the available methods for calculating the feature importance. Columns Classif, Regr and Surv indicate if classification, regression or survival analysis problems are supported. Columns Fac., Num. and Ord. show if a particular method can deal with factor, numeric and ordered factor features.

Current methods

Method Package Description Classif Regr Surv Fac. Num. Ord. NA NA NA
anova.test ANOVA Test for binary and multiclass classification tasks X X
auc AUC filter for binary classification tasks X X
carscore care CAR scores X X
cforest.importance party Permutation importance of random forest fitted in package â€˜partyâ€™ X X X X X X
FSelector_chi.squared FSelector Chi-squared statistic of independence between feature and target X X X X
FSelector_gain.ratio FSelector Entropy-based gain ratio between feature and target X X X X
FSelector_information.gain FSelector Entropy-based information gain between feature and target X X X X
FSelector_oneR FSelector oneR association rule X X X X
FSelector_relief FSelector RELIEF algorithm X X X X
FSelector_symmetrical.uncertainty FSelector Entropy-based symmetrical uncertainty between feature and target X X X X
FSelectorRcpp_gain.ratio FSelectorRcpp Entropy-based Filters: Algorithms that find ranks of importance of discrete attributes, basing on their entropy with a continous class attribute X X X X X X X
FSelectorRcpp_information.gain FSelectorRcpp Entropy-based Filters: Algorithms that find ranks of importance of discrete attributes, basing on their entropy with a continous class attribute X X X X X X X
FSelectorRcpp_symmetrical.uncertainty FSelectorRcpp Entropy-based Filters: Algorithms that find ranks of importance of discrete attributes, basing on their entropy with a continous class attribute X X X X X X X
kruskal.test Kruskal Test for binary and multiclass classification tasks X X X
linear.correlation Pearson correlation between feature and target X X
permutation.importance Aggregated difference between feature permuted and unpermuted predictions X X X X X X
praznik_CMIM praznik Minimal conditional mutual information maximisation filter X X X X X X X
praznik_DISR praznik Double input symmetrical relevance filter X X X X X X
praznik_JMI praznik Joint mutual information filter X X X X X X
praznik_JMIM praznik Minimal joint mutual information maximisation filter X X X X X X
praznik_MIM praznik conditional mutual information based feature selection filters X X X X X X
praznik_MRMR praznik Minimum redundancy maximal relevancy filter X X X X X X
praznik_NJMIM praznik Minimal normalised joint mutual information maximisation filter X X X X X X
randomForest.importance randomForest Importance based on OOB-accuracy or node inpurity of random forest fitted in package â€˜randomForestâ€™. X X X X
randomForestSRC.rfsrc randomForestSRC Importance of random forests fitted in package â€˜randomForestSRCâ€™. Importance is calculated using argument â€˜permuteâ€™. X X X X X X
randomForestSRC.var.select randomForestSRC Minimal depth of / variable hunting via method var.select on random forests fitted in package â€˜randomForestSRCâ€™. X X X X X X
ranger.impurity ranger Variable importance based on ranger impurity importance X X X X X
ranger.permutation ranger Variable importance based on ranger permutation importance X X X X X X
rank.correlation Spearmanâ€™s correlation between feature and target X X
univariate.model.score Resamples an mlr learner for each input feature individually. The resampling performance is used as filter score, with rpart as default learner. X X X X X X
variance A simple variance filter X X X X

Deprecated methods

Method Package Description Classif Regr Surv Fac. Num. Ord. NA NA NA
rf.importance randomForestSRC Importance of random forests fitted in package â€˜randomForestSRCâ€™. Importance is calculated using argument â€˜permuteâ€™. (DEPRECATED) X X X X X X
rf.min.depth randomForestSRC Minimal depth of random forest fitted in package â€™randomForestSRC. (DEPRECATED) X X X X X X
univariate Resamples an mlr learner for each input feature individually. The resampling performance is used as filter score, with rpart as default learner. (DEPRECATED) X X X X X X
